text: {"answer":"A","reasoning":"Option A contains the Court’s standard ‘master of the characterisation’ formulation and, crucially, distinguishes between remedies against a private individual (the stepfather) and remedies against the State, concluding the complaint should be examined under Article 8 alone. The other options are generic or relate to different factual contexts (e.g., secret surveillance in D) and lack this specific remedies/characterisation framing."}
